title: Unlocking the Potential of Local Hydrogen: Fukushima's Quest - Denso
summary: DENSO Fukushima is piloting a carbon-neutral factory project using hydrogen produced on-site from renewable energy. The project aims to create a local energy system where hydrogen is produced, stored, and used within the region, contributing to Japan's goal of carbon neutrality by 2050. The initiative has garnered significant local interest, with the hope that it will revitalize local industries and communities while serving as a model for other regions.

title: Navitas Debuts Next-gen GaNSafe Power Components - Eetasia.com
summary: Navitas Semiconductor has launched its new GaNSafe series of GaN power components, designed for high-power applications such as data centers, solar energy, and electric vehicles. The GaNSafe series boasts high efficiency, power density, and reliability, while addressing challenges like heat dissipation and control in high-voltage applications. This new generation of GaN products is expected to lead the market for high-power GaN Power ICs and capture a significant share of the GaN market for Navitas.

title: Aichi Sangyo: a leading industrial solution provider for metal processing industries - The Worldfolio
summary: Aichi, a Japanese engineering trading company, has been supplying technology to major Japanese manufacturers for 86 years. The company is focused on welding technology, metallurgical technology, and machine tool-related products and imports cutting-edge technology from around the world.  Aichi also aims to provide long-term visions for SMEs and help them adapt to the changing demands of the market, including the need for digitalization and automation.
